intro: Stephanomeria schottii, commonly known as the Schott's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its globular shape and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Stephanomeria schottii is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
